Stop/limit (stop loss/take profit) attached to position

public class StopLimitOrder : IStopLossTakeProfitSubmissionParameters

Remarks

In general, this is a particular case of Order. In classic trade model, there is no built-in stop loss or take profit for position This must be managed by opening a couple orders linked by OCO: Stop market for SL and Limit for TP. For pending order, in classic model, you can create a couple of if-done orders linked by OCO. See details about if-done orders :/ http://www.investorwords.com/18234/if_done_order.html https://support.exante.eu/hc/en-us/articles/360034819871-Conditional-Orders-One-Cancels-the-Other-and-If-Done For convenience, we provide a shortcut to work with SL and TP by providing a reference from position to the order which is considered as a SL or TP Pay attention that this class does not have a direct reference to Order, only to its id. This is because such orders are available only after position open. When you create a pending order with SL and TP (StopLossParameters and TakeProfitParameters) a result order can have only the ids of future if-done orders, but really those order do not exist until main order is filled In general action chain looks this way:

  1. Client submits an order and sets stop loss and take profit orders via IOrderSubmissionParameters
  2. Broker creates 3 orders: this (main) order and 2 if-done "frozen" orders which do not exist yet but their OrderId is already generated
  3. As soon as main order fills, "frozen" if-done is activated

Properties

OrderId

Order id, assigned by broker Initially, when parent order is just created/submitted but still not accepted by broker, it is null After broker is accepted the order (Accepted) it will assign id

public string? OrderId { get; }

Property Value

string

Price

A shortcut to price of order For stop loss this is StopPrice For take profit this is LimitPrice

public double Price { get; }
